column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////We were quickly seated
column2: waiters were friendly and quick. We had the gyoza for appetizer
column4: wish the price was a little lower
column5: but we enjoyed it nonetheless. For the meal
column6: I ordered the tonkatsu black and spicy. The spice level was right in the middle
column7: which was perfect. I prefer to have a ramen with a bit of spice but not to a point where I am sweating and crying. The broth was creamy but not too heavy. The pork was very soft and almost melted in my mouth! They also gave a WHOLE egg! I was very happy with that and the egg was cooked to perfection (a bit runny
column8: which is what I always look for at traditional ramen places). The portions were great
column9: and I was stuffed towards the end.
